newsitem.title: USA: Maine man's claim to be killer may be true.
newsitem.headline: Maine man's claim to be killer may be true.

text.p: When James Darrow claimed to be a killer, few believed him in this small woodland town near the Quebec border. It turns out he may have been telling the truth.

Darrow, 37, who residents said on Thursday had a reputation as a braggart and teller of tall tales, was charged this week with beating to death John Avery, his sister's boyfriend, in Connecticut in May 1985.
"They don't call (him) 'Big Jim the Liar' for nothing. You name it, he lied about it," Michael Forgue, a restaurant owner in the town where Darrow has lived for several years and worked as a cook.
Forgue said that among Darrow's stories was one in which he claimed to have killed a man in Connecticut.
"Who knows? Who could believe him? No one," said Forgue, adding that Darrow's story about how the man died varied from telling to telling.
Connectictut police said they began probing the Avery case recently after receiving new information, but declined to specify what the information was.

Authorities said Darrow confessed to killing Avery in Franklin, Connecticut, and dumping his body in a swamp. Darrow helped searchers on Tuesday find remains believed to be Avery's, according to Connecticut State Police.
